info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 4 at 8:45PM CDT until July 7 at 4:36AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
San Saba River At San Saba affecting San Saba County.
For the San Saba River...including Brady, Menard, San Saba...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...San Saba River at San Saba.
* WHEN...Until early Monday morning.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 33.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Friday was 33.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon and continue falling to 4.9 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1000 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING
